Roma close on Smalling deal

Roma continue negotiations with Manchester United to sign Chris Smalling on a permanent basis, on loan with obligation to buy for €17-18m.

His one-season loan is coming to an end, but the England international defender has been revitalised by his time in Serie A and is eager to remain.

According to the latest reports from Tele Radio Stereo, the Giallorossi are edging closer to an agreement with his parent club.

The idea would be to sign Smalling on to another loan deal with obligation to buy at the end of the 2020-21 season.

It would effectively be a purchase, but with the payment spread out over two years.

Manchester United had originally wanted €25m, but seem to have been negotiated down to €17-18m.

Inter, deal for Lautaro with Barcelona remains difficult; Aubameyang could be alternative if he departs

Inter director Beppe Marotta gave his comments in Inter's post-match on the rumors of a sale of Lautaro Martinez to Barcelona: "Lautaro is wanted by many but we're optimistic about him staying." The deal with the blaugrana is in standby, while the position of Inter remains steady: Lautaro can leave for his release clause of €111 million or an offer in the region. Barcelona has not yet presented a satisfactory offer to Inter. Barcelona additionally are facing new regulations due to the current economic climate around their total possible market expenditure, to further complicate a deal.

Inter are still making preparations for an eventual replacement for Lautaro, with Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang as a target. The Arsenal striker is also on the radar of Barcelona should they not succeed in landing the Argentine from Inter.

https://gianlucadimarzio.com/en/inter-deal-for-lautaro-with-barcelona-remains-difficult-aubameyang-could-be-alternative-if-he-departs

Jude Bellingham rejects offers from Manchester United & Chelsea in favour of Borussia Dortmund

Birmingham City midfielder Jude Bellingham has rejected offers from Premier League duo Manchester United and Chelsea and will sign for Borussia Dortmund, according to Ruhr Nachrichten.

The Bundesliga club will pay a compensation fee around €20 million and is expected to join Borussia Dortmund in the coming days.

Bellingham and his father made a commitment to join Borussia Dortmund, despite being courted by several clubs. There’s a greater chance that the 16-year-old would play first team football in Germany and so it suits his development.

The youngster has played 33 Championship games for Birmingham City and has represented England at youth level.

RB Leipzig reach agreement in principle with Benjamin Henrichs (AS Monaco)

RB Leipzig have reached an agreement in principle with 23-year-old AS Monaco defender Benjamin Henrichs, according to Sky Germany.

The Germany international wants to return to Germany after finding playing time at the Ligue 1 club hard to come by after joining Monaco from Bayer Leverkusen in 2018 for €20 million.

RB Leipzig head coach Julian Nagelsmann has been keen on signing Henrichs, this being the third attempt at signing the defender and whilst the Bundesliga club want to make a deal, Monaco are hoping to recoup the €20m fee they paid for the German.

The departure of Timo Werner to Premier League club Chelsea for €60 million will allow RB Leipzig to strengthen their squad in the summer.

Lazio in pole position for Marash Kumbulla as Inter put talks on hold

Gianluca Di Marzio reports that negotiations between Inter and Hellas Verona regarding the sale of defender Marash Kumbulla have come to a halt, with the Nerazzuri looking to raise funds before completing any signings.

While talks had been ongoing between the two clubs, Lazio have emerged as the favourites to sign the Albanian, who will look to get a deal over the line as soon as possible thanks to the good relationship between the two clubs’ presidents.

Milan return favoured by Thiago Silva as Fiorentina initiate contacts

Gianluca Di Marzio reports that Thiago Silva, who is set to leave Paris Saint-Germain at the end of the season, sees former club Milan as his preferred destination.

Nevertheless, no contact has been made between either of the parties so far, with Fiorentina instead the frontrunners to secure the Brazilian’s signing. The Viola will look to complete a transfer in the vein of Franck Ribéry’s arrival last summer, having already initiated contacts with the defender.

LAMPARD: NO BIDS FOR HAVERTZ

Frank Lampard says Chelsea have not made a bid for Bayer Leverkusen winger Kai Havertz.

Sky Sports News reported earlier this month that Chelsea want to sign the 20-year-old Germany international this summer, although they face competition from Bayern Munich and Real Madrid.

"He's a top player but we're certainly not going to comment on players at other teams," said the Chelsea head coach. "It cannot be our focus. No bids have gone in."

Bardsley Signs New Deal

Phil Bardsley has signed a new contract to extend his stay at Turf Moor for a further year.

The Scotland international follows Nick Pope, Charlie Taylor, Chris Wood, Ashley Barnes and Robbie Brady to have committed to next season and beyond, with midfielder Ashley Westwood also triggering an extension to his deal to stay until June, 2021.

However, midfielder Jeff Hendrick is to leave Turf Moor to end his four-year stay with the Clarets after the club was unable to agree terms on a new deal with the Republic of Ireland international.

And goalkeepers Joe Hart and Adam Legzdins and winger Aaron Lennon are also leaving after reaching the end of their contracts.

Layvin Kurzawa to double current salary with new PSG contract

France Football confirm reporting from RMC Sport last night that Layvin Kurzawa has agreed in principle to sign a new 4-year contract with PSG, with his current deal due to expire at the end of August when the 2019/20 Champions’ League action has been completed.

Bayern Munich will allow Thiago to leave

Bayern Munich will allow Thiago Alcântara to leave the Bundesliga club in the summer if they find a suitable buyer, according to Bild.

With just one-year remaining on his Bayern contract, they hope to earn around €30 million from the sale of Thiago, with Liverpool and Manchester United reportedly interested in signing the Spaniard.

Jürgen Klopp could imagine himself working with Thiago and despite there being no contact as of yet, Bayern CEO Karl-Heinz Rummenigge has conceded that the 29-year-old is likely to leave the club.

“We negotiated seriously with him and fulfilled all of his wishes,” Rummenigge told Bild. “But it looks like he may want to do something new at the end of his career. We’ve never had any contact with Liverpool. If he wants that, we’ll have to deal with it. We don’t want to lose a player for free next year.”

Benjamin Henrichs completes RB Leipzig medical

AS Monaco defender Benjamin Henrichs is expected to complete his move to RB Leipzig after completing his medical check on Tuesday.

According to Kicker, the 23-year-old will join the Bundesliga club on a season-long loan whilst RB Leipzig have an option to purchase Henrichs for a fee reported to be around €15 million.

The Germany international has a contract with AS Monaco until 2023 after joining the French outfit from Bayer Leverkusen in 2018 but after failing to impress, Henrichs will join RB Leipzig.

Even with the arrival of Henrichs and both Lukas Klostermann and Nordi Mukiele being able to play in central defence, this move will not have an effect of Dayot Upamecano’s future with Julian Nagelsmann’s side.

Even with the arrival of Henrichs and both Lukas Klostermann and Nordi Mukiele being able to play in central defence, this move will not have an effect of Dayot Upamecano’s future with Julian Nagelsmann’s side.

Borussia Mönchengladbach in talks to sign Hannes Wolf

Borussia Mönchengladbach are in discussions to sign 21-year-old RB Leipzig midfielder Hannes Wolf on loan with an option to buy, according to Kicker.

RB Leipzig would like to recoup the €12 million they paid RB Salzburg last summer for Wolf however, Gladbach are unable to pay a substantial fee to sign the Austria international due to the financial impact of Coronavirus.

And so, RB Leipzig would be open to loaning out Wolf with a purchase option, which would suit Borussia Mönchengladbach, who qualified for the Champions League.

Gladbach sporting director Max Eberl stated earlier in the week that he’s only looking to bring in one or two new signings to the Bundesliga club, one of them being an attacking player for no more than €10m.

OGC Nice looking at Denis Bouanga (St Étienne) & Rony Lopes (Sevilla)

France Football and Foot 365 report that Ligue 1 side OGC Nice are pressing on with their attempts to sign a wide attacker, following their decisions not to activate their option to buy Adam Ounas from Napoli and to sell Ignatius Ganago for €6m to RC Lens.

Aside from Jérémie Boga of Sassuolo, for whom there is intense market competition, Les Aiglons are looking at Sevilla’s Portuguese international winger Rony Lopes (24) and St Étienne’s attacking dynamo Denis Bouanga (25) as possible options.

The Gabonese international scored 10 goals and laid on 3 assists in 26 matches this season – under contract with Les Verts until 2023, his entourage has made it clear that Bouanga wants to have European football next season.

Meanwhile, unconvincing at Sevilla and making only 15 appearances this season, Rony Lopes is under contract with the La Liga side until June 2024.

Piotr Zieli≈Ñski confirms incoming Napoli contract extension: “Hopefully the announcement will come in the next few days.”

Speaking to Sky Sport Italia, Napoli midfielder Piotr Zieli≈Ñski discussed his contract situation, confirming that he would renew his current deal, which expires in a year. The Pole was also keen to underline how Gennaro Gattuso’s arrival has impacted his season positively

“The three of them [Sarri, Ancelotti and Gattuso] are great managers. Gattuso has strong charisma, we felt it straight away when he arrived in the dressing room like he did as a player – he’s tough. He was a great player. We speak often, he gives me advice on how to position myself between the lines, to look forward, find team-mates and shoot at goal.”

“[Gattuso] has been very important, we’ve been negotiating for some time, hopefully the announcement will come in the next few days. My agent is the one who takes care of those things, I can only say that I’m doing really well and that I want to keep playing at Napoli.”
